sources.title: The Crosby Case
sources.description: “This oldie plays well today” (IMDB review quote). An entertaining Universal Pictures whodunit with an unusually large cast of familiar faces for a B-mystery, and enough twists and turns to hold your interest. Pre-code. Remade in 1946 as “Blonde Alibi.” IMDB 6.3. Directed by Edwin L Marin. Released in 1934. Two minutes are missing (VHS transfer) CAST NOTE: Sixteen of the twenty-six cast members are uncredited. Among the uncredited are Leon Ames, Mischa Auer, Walter Brennan and Harold Huber.

metadata.Plot: In this 1934 per-code film with the selling and using illegal drugs driving the plot, a Doctor Crosby is found dead in the street, apparently run over by an automobile, but it is discovered that he was actually murdered---shot in the back by a 38-calibre bullet. But by who? And why?
metadata.Actors: Wynne Gibson, Onslow Stevens, Richard 'Skeets' Gallagher
